headline: Disney Replaces Public Relations Chief Amid Florida Furor
author: Christopher Palmeri
sentences: Disneys opposition to Florida legislation banning discussion of sexual orientation and gender identity in classrooms with kids third grade and younger prompted Governor Ron DeSantis and other Republicans to terminate a special municipal district the company has operated in Florida since the 1960s.

Walt Disney Co.s new head of corporate affairs, Geoff Morrell, is leaving after just three months on the job amid the furor over the companys opposition to a Florida bill restricting discussion of sexual orientation in schools.
Morrell, a former chief of communications at oil giant BP Plc and spokesman for the Pentagon, joined Disney in January, replacing longtime public relations chief Zenia Mucha, who retired.
